borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed outbuilding by reason of excessive scale presents a discordant feature which introduces an element of incongruous built form, resulting in a disruption to the garden setting. Therefore, the outbuilding is considered harmful to the appearance of the house and character of the area.&nbsp; As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policies D1, D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</p><p>- Policies SP 2, DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation Version, October 2020);</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</p>

<p>The proposed outbuilding by reason of excessive scale would result in an increased sense of overbearingness to neighbouring occupiers, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</p><p>- Policies DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation Version, October 2020);</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</p>
description: Construction of a single storey outbuilding to create a granny annex and storage in the rear garden.
